alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued February 03 at 2:34PM AKST until February 04 at 1:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM AKST FRIDAY FOR THE KUSKOKWIM DELTA COAST... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions occurring. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches. Northeasterly winds gusting as high as 50 mph. Visibility reductions to one-quarter mile. * WHERE...Kuskokwim Delta coast. * WHEN...Until 1 AM AKST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions. Areas of blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility down to one- quarter mile. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blizzard conditions are occurring along the immediate Kuskokwim Delta coast and are expected to continue through Thursday night. Gusty winds will reach 35 to 40 mph with gusts as high as 50 mph. Conditions should begin to improve from south to north by Thursday night as the front exits to the northwest.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle.
